description: On 20th March 2021, The Ministry of Education, Youth, and Sports of the Royal Government of Cambodia called on the country to close all schools, after a Coronavirus outbreak found in Phnom Penh and Kandal province. description: On 08 February 2021, the Ministry of Health announced the vaccination of the COVID-19 vaccine program. The vaccination will officially commence on 10 February 2021 at some public hospitals such as Calematte, Preah Ang Duong Hospital, Khmer Soviet Friendship Hospital, and the National Pediatric Hospital.
type_sub_cat: Administering of the vaccine (i.e. giving people the vaccine shot)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On 12 February 2021, the Ministry of Health issued an announcement informing the public that the Ministry has decided to grant  Astra Zeneca’s COVID-19 Vaccine for the Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) in Cambodia.
type_sub_cat: Regulatory approval process for administering the COVID-19 vaccine
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 28 February 2021, the Ministry of Health released an announcement on the COVID-19 vaccination (Sinopharm) for garbage workers in Phnom Penh, a valuable humanitarian aid of the People’s Republic of China.
type_sub_cat: Administering of the vaccine (i.e. giving people the vaccine shot)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: At a virtual meeting initiated by Prime Minister Hun Sen on March 10, Cambodia, Vietnam and Laos have vowed to strengthen cooperation and agreed to mutually provide free Covid-19 vaccinations to diplomats and students residing in the three countries.
type_sub_cat: Administering of the vaccine (i.e. giving people the vaccine shot)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Kingdom’s acting head of state Say Chhum on March 11 promulgated the Law on Measures to Prevent the Spread of Covid-19 and Other Serious, Dangerous and Contagious Diseases, comprising six chapters and 18 articles and defines measures, penalties, scope and the enforcement authority, as well as to demonstrate the government's willingness to assume greater responsibility as the country faces threats posed by Covid-19.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Cambodia is enforcing a ban on all religious gatherings from March 17.

Cambodia is enforcing a ban on all religious gatherings from March 17. UPDATE: Mosques and churches have been permitted to open starting September 11, 2020, while monasteries remain closed indefinitely.
Kampong Speu provincial governor Vei Samnang decided to temporarily ban all public gatherings including wedding ceremonies starting March 10 in a bid to contain the Covid-19 pandemic.
type_sub_cat: All/Unspecified mass gatherings
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
